elements.content:
Below you will find a series of statements that may relate to worrying.
Thinking about times when you worry, please indicate how true the following statements are for you.

elements.text: If I did not worry, I would be careless and irresponsible.
If I worry, I will be less shaken when unexpected events occur.
I worry in order to know what to do.
If I worry in advance, I will be less disappointed if something serious happens.
Worrying helps me plan my actions to solve a problem.
The mere fact of worrying can prevent misfortunes from happening.
If I did not worry, it would make me a negligent person.
It is by worrying that I end up undertaking the work I have to do.
I worry because I think it can help me find a solution to my problem.
The fact that I worry proves that I am a person who takes care of their affairs.
Thinking too much about positive things can prevent them from happening.
The fact that I worry confirms that I am a forward-thinking person.
If a misfortune happens, I will feel less responsible if I worried about it beforehand.
By worrying, I can find a better way to do things.
Worry stimulates me and makes me more efficient.
The fact that I worry motivates me to take action.
The mere fact of worrying reduces the risk that something serious will happen.
By worrying, I do certain things that I would not decide to do otherwise.
The fact that I worry motivates me to do the things I need to do.
My worries alone can reduce the risks of danger.
By worrying, I increase my chances of finding the best solution.
The fact that I worry will allow me to feel less guilty if something serious happens.
If I worry, I will be less sad when a negative event occurs.
By not worrying, one can attract misfortunes.
The fact that I worry shows that I am a good person.
